info.text: The default category for questions shared in context '3.3 Solving Polynomial Equations'.

name.text: 3.3.1.1 Multiplying polynomials together

questiontext.text:
Multiplying polynomials together Multiplisere sammen polynomer

Key Point Nøkkelpunkt

A polynomial expression is one of the form Et polynomuttrykk er skrevet på formen

\[a_nx^n + a_{n-1}x^{n-1} + \ldots +a_2x^2+a_1x+a_0\]

where \(a_0\), \(a_1\),\(\ldots\), \(a_n\) are known coefficients (numbers), \(a_n \ne 0\), and \(x\) is a variable. hvor \(a_0\), \(a_1\),\(\ldots\), \(a_n\) er kjente koeffisienter (tall), \(a_n \ne 0\), og \(x\) er en variabel.

\(n\) must be a positive integer. \(n\) må være et positivt heltall.


For example \(x^3-17x^2+54x-8\) is a polynomial expression in \(x\). The polynomial may be expressed in terms of a variable other than \(x\). So, the following are also polynomial expressions: For eksempel er \(x^3-17x^2+54x-8\) et polynomuttrykk i \(x\). Polynomet kan uttrykkes med andre variabler enn \(x\) slik at følgende også er polynomuttrykk:

\(\qquad t^3-t^2+t-3\qquad z^5-1\qquad w^4+10w^2-12\qquad s+1. \)

Note that only non-negative whole number powers of the variable (usually \(x\)) are allowed in a polynomial expression. In this Section you will learn how to factorise simple polynomial expressions and how to solve some polynomial equations. You will also learn the technique of equating coefficients. This process is very important when we need to perform calculations involving partial fractions which will be considered in Section 6. Merk at bare positive heltalleksponenter av variabelen (vanligvis \(x\)) er tillatt i et polynomuttrykk. I denne delen lærer du hvordan du faktoriserer enkle polynomuttrykk og hvordan du løser noen polynomlikninger. Du vil også lære teknikken for å likestille koeffisienter. Denne prosessen er veldig viktig når vi trenger å utføre beregninger som involverer delbrøker som vil bli vurdert i avsnitt 6.

The degree of a polynomial is the highest power to which the variable is raised. Thus \(x^3+6x+2\) has degree \(3\), \(t^6-6t^4+2t\) has degree \(6\), and \(5x+2\) has degree \(1\). Graden til et polynom er lik den høyeste eksponenten. Således har \(x^3+6x+2\) grad \(3\), \(t^6-6t^4+2t\) grad \(6\), og \(5x+2\) har grad \(1\).

Let us consider what happens when two polynomials are multiplied together. For example La oss vurdere hva som skjer når to polynomer multipliseres sammen. For eksempel er

\(\qquad (x+1)(3x-2) \)

is the product of two first degree polynomials. Expanding the brackets we obtain produktet av to førstegradspolynomer. Ved å åpne parentesene vi får tak i

\(\qquad (x+1)(3x-2)= 3x^2+x-2 \)

which is a second degree polynomial. som er et andregradspolynom.

In general we can regard a second degree polynomial, or quadratic, as the product of two first degree polynomials, provided that the quadratic can be factorised. Similarly Generelt kan vi betrakte et andregradspolynom som produktet av to førstegradspolynomer, forutsatt at polynomet kan faktoriseres. På samme måte er

\(\qquad (x-1)(x^2+3x-7) = x^3+2x^2-10x+7 \)

is a third degree, or cubic, polynomial which is thus the product of a linear polynomial and a quadratic polynomial. et tredjegrads, eller kubisk, polynom som altså er produktet av et lineært polynom og et andregradspolynom.

In general we can regard a cubic polynomial as the product of a linear polynomial and a quadratic polynomial or the product of three linear polynomials. This fact will be important in the following Section when we come to factorise cubics. Generelt kan vi betrakte et tredjegradspolynom som produktet av et lineært polynom og et andregradspolynom, eller produktet av tre lineære polynomer. Dette faktum vil være viktig i det følgende avsnittet når vi skal faktorisere tredjegradspolynomer.

Key Point Nøkkelpunkt

A cubic expression can always be formulated as a linear expression times a quadratic expression. Et tredjegrads uttrykk kan alltid formuleres som et lineært uttrykk ganger et kvadratisk uttrykk.

name.text: 3.3.2.1 Factorising polynomials and equating coefficients

questiontext.text:
Factorising polynomials and equating coefficients Faktorisering av polynomer og likestilling av koeffisienter

We will consider how we might find the solution to some simple polynomial equations. An important part of this process is being able to express a complicated polynomial into a product of simpler polynomials. This involves factorisation. Vi skal nå vurdere hvordan vi kan finne løsningen på noen enkle polynomlikninger. En viktig del av denne prosessen er å kunne uttrykke et komplisert polynom som et produkt av enklere polynomer. Dette involverer faktorisering.

Factorisation of polynomial expressions can be achieved more easily if one or more of the factors is already known. This requires a knowledge of the technique of 'equating coefficients' which is illustrated in the following example. Det er lettere å faktorisere polynomuttrykk hvis en eller flere av faktorene allerede er kjent. Dette krever kunnskap om å "likestille koeffisienter" som er illustrert i følgende eksempel.

Example Eksempel

Factorise the expression \(x^3-17x^2+54x-8\) given that one of the factors is \((x-4)\). Faktoriser uttrykket \(x^3-17x^2+54x-8\) gitt at en av faktorene er \((x-4)\).

Solution Løsning

Given that \(x-4\) is a factor we can write Gitt at \(x-4\) er en faktor vi kan skrive

\(\qquad x^3-17x^2+54x-8 = (x-4) \times \hbox{(a quadratic polynomial et andregradspolynom)} \).

The polynomial must be quadratic because the expression on the left is cubic and \(x-4\) is linear. Suppose we write this quadratic as \(a x^2+b x+c\) where \(a\), \(b\), and \(c\) are unknown numbers which we need to find. Then Polynomet må være kvadratisk fordi uttrykket til venstre er kubisk og \(x-4\) er lineært. Anta at vi skriver dette andregradsuttrykket som \(a x^2+b x+c\) hvor \(a\), \(b\) og \(c\) er ukjente tall som vi må finne. Da har vi

\(\qquad x^3-17x^2+54x-8 = (x-4)(a x^2+b x+c) \).

Removing the brackets on the right and collecting like terms together we have Ved å åpne parantesene til høyre og samle alle leddene med samme grad sammen får vi

\( \qquad x^3-17x^2+54x-8 = a x^3 + (b-4a)x^2 +(c-4b)x -4c \).

Like terms are those which involve the same power of the variable (\(x\)).

Equating coefficients means that we compare the coefficients of each term on the left with the corresponding term on the right. Thus if we look at the \(x^3\) terms on each side we see that \(x^3 = a x^3\) which implies \(a\) must equal \(1\). Similarly by equating coefficients of \(x^2\) we find \(-17 = b-4a\). With \(a=1\) we have \(-17=b-4\) so \(b\) must equal to \(-13\). Finally, equating constant terms we find \(-8 = -4c\) so that \(c=2\). Likestille koeffisienter betyr at vi sammenligner koeffisientene til hvert ledd til venstre med det tilsvarende leddet til høyre. Hvis vi ser på \(x^3\)-leddene på hver side, ser vi at \(x^3 = a x^3\) som innebærer at \(a\) må være lik \(1\). Tilsvarende ved å likestille koeffisientene til \(x^2\) finner vi \(-17 = b-4a\). Med \(a=1\) har vi \(-17=b-4\) så \(b\) må være lik \(-13\). Til slutt, ved å likestille konstante ledd finner vi \(-8 = -4c\) slik at \(c=2\).

As a check we look at the coefficient of \(x\) to ensure it is the same on both sides. Now that we know \(a=1\), \(b=-13\), \(c=2\) we can write the polynomial expression as Som en sjekk ser vi på koeffisienten til \(x\) for å sikre at den er lik på begge sider. Nå som vi vet \(a=1\), \(b=-13\), \(c=2\) kan vi skrive polynomuttrykket som

\(\qquad x^3-17x^2+54x-8=(x-4)(x^2-13x+2)\).

name.text: 3.3.4.1 Polynomial equations

questiontext.text:
Polynomial equations Polynomligninger

When a polynomial expression is equated to zero, a polynomial equation is obtained. Linear and quadratic equations, which you have already met, are particular types of polynomial equation. En polynomligning kan definseres som et polynomuttrykk satt lik null. Lineære og kvadratiske ligninger, som du allerede har møtt, er spesielle typer polynomligninger.

Key Point Nøkkelpunkt

A polynomial equation has the form En polynomligning har formen

\[a_nx^n+a_{n-1}x^{n-1} + \ldots a_2x^2+a_1x+a_0 = 0\]

where \(a_0\), \(a_1\), \(\dots\), \(a_n\) are known coefficients, \(a_n \ne 0\), and \(x\) represents an unknown whose value(s) are to be found. hvor \(a_0\), \(a_1\), \(\dots\), \(a_n\) er kjente koeffisienter, \(a_n \ne 0\), og \(x\) representerer ukjente verdier som må bestemmes.


Polynomial equations of low degree have special names. A polynomial equation of degree 1 is a linear equation and the solution of such equations have already been shown. Degree 2 polynomials are called quadratics; degree 3 polynomials are called cubics; degree 4 equations are called quartics and so on. The following are examples of polynomial equations: Polynomligninger av lav grad har fått spesielle navn. En polynomligning av grad 1 er en lineær ligning og løsningen av slike ligninger er allerede vist. Grad 2 polynomer kalles kvadratiske ligninger; grad 3 polynomer kalles kubiske ligninger og så videre. Følgende er eksempler på polynomligninger:

\(\qquad 5x^6-3x^4+x^2+7=0, \qquad -7x^4+x^2+9=0,\qquad t^3-t+5=0,\qquad w^7-3w-1=0 \)

Recall that the degree of the equation is the highest power of \(x\) occurring. The solutions or roots of the equation are those values of \(x\) which satisfy the equation. Husk at ligningens graden  er lik den høyeste eksponenten til \(x\). Løsningene eller røttene til ligningen er lik verdiene til \(x\) som tilfredsstiller ligningen.

Key Point Nøkkelpunkt

A polynomial equation of degree \(n\) has \(n\) roots. En polynomligning av grad \(n\) har \(n\) røtter.

Some (possibly all) of the roots may be repeated. Noen (muligens alle) røttene kan være like.

Some (possibly all) of the roots may be complex. Noen (muligens alle) røttene kan være komplekse.

Example Eksempel

Verify that \(x=-1\), \(x=1\), and \(x=0\) are solutions (roots) of the equation Bekreft at \(x=-1\), \(x=1\) og \(x=0\) er løsninger (røtter) av ligningen

\( \qquad x^3-x=0 \).

Solution Løsning

We substitute each value in turn into \(x^3-x\). Vi setter etter tur de oppgitte verdiene i \(x^3-x\).

\( \qquad (-1)^3 - (-1) = -1 + 1 = 0 \)

so \(x=-1\) is clearly a root. som tydeligvis betyr at \(x=-1\) er en rot.

It is easy to verify similarly that \(x=1\) and \(x=0\) are also solutions. Det er på samme måte enkelt å verifisere at \(x=1\) og \(x=0\) også er løsninger.

In the next subsection we will consider ways in which polynomial equations of higher degree than quadratic can be solved. I det neste avsnittet vil vi undersøke løsningsmetoder for polynomlikninger av høyere grad enn kvadratiske ligninger.

name.text: 3.3.6.1 Solving polynomial equations when one solution is known

questiontext.text:
Solving polynomial equations when one solution is known Løse polynomligninger når én løsning er kjent

We have already seen a formula which can be used to solve quadratic equations. Unfortunately when dealing with equations of higher degree no simple formulae exist. If one of the roots can be spotted or is known we can sometimes find the others by themethod shown in the next example. Vi har allerede sett en formel som kan brukes til å løse andregradsligninger. Dessverre finnes det ingen enkle formler når det gjelder ligninger av høyere grad. Hvis en av røttene kan oppdages eller er kjent, kan vi noen ganger finne de andre ved hjelp av metoden vist i neste eksempel.

Example Eksempel

Let the polynomial expression \(x^3-17x^2+54x-8\) be denoted by \(P(x)\). Verify that \(x=4\) is a solution of the equation \(P(x)=0\). Hence find the other solutions. La polynomuttrykket \(x^3-17x^2+54x-8\) betegnes med \(P(x)\). Bekreft at \(x=4\) er en løsning av ligningen \(P(x)=0\). Finn deretter de andre løsningene.

Solution Løsning

We substitute \(x=4\) into the polynomial expression \(P(x)\): Vi setter \(x=4\) i polynomuttrykket \(P(x)\):

\(\qquad P(4)=4^3 - 17(4^2) + 54(4) - 8 = 64 -272 + 216 - 8 = 0 \).

So, when \(x=4\) the left-hand side equals zero. Hence \(x=4\) is indeed a solution. Knowing that \(x=4\) is a root we can state that \((x-4)\) must be a factor of \(P(x)\). Therefore \(P(x)\) can be re-written as a product of a linear and a quadratic term: Så når \(x=4\) er venstre side lik null. \(x=4\) er altså en løsning. Når vi vet at \(x=4\) er en rot, kan vi si at \((x-4)\) må være en faktor av \(P(x)\). Derfor kan \(P(x)\) omskrives som et produkt av en lineær og en kvadratisk term:

\(\qquad P(x)= x^3-17x^2+54x -8 = (x-4) \times \hbox{ (quadratic polynomial kvadratisk polynom)} \).

The quadratic polynomial has already been found in a previous task so we deduce that the given equation can be written Det kvadratiske polynomet er allerede funnet i en tidligere oppgave, så vi utleder at den gitte ligningen kan skrives som

\(\qquad P(x)=x^3-17x^2+54x-8=(x-4)(x^2-13x+2) = 0 \).  

In this form we see that \( x-4 = 0 \quad \hbox{ or } \quad x^2 -13x + 2 = 0 \). I denne formen ser vi at \( x-4 = 0 \quad \hbox{ eller } \quad x^2 -13x + 2 = 0 \).

The first equation gives \(x=4\) which we already knew. Den første ligningen gir \(x=4\) som vi allerede visste.

The second equation must be solved using one of the previously seen methods for solving quadratic equations. For example, using the formula we find Den andre ligningen må løses ved hjelp av en av de tidligere metodene for andregradsligninger. For eksempel ved å bruke abc-formelen finner vi

\[\begin{aligned} x &= {-b\pm \sqrt{b^2-4ac}\over 2a}\qquad\text{with med}\ a=1,\ b=-13,\ c=2\\ &= {13\pm \sqrt{(-13)^2-4.1.2}\over 2} \\ &= {13 \pm \sqrt{161}\over 2}= {13\pm 12.6886\over 2}. \qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad \end{aligned}\]

So \(x= 12.8443\) and \(x= 0.1557\) are roots of \(x^2-13x+2\). Så \(x= 12.8443\) og \(x= 0.1557\) er røtter av \(x^2-13x+2\).

Hence the three solutions of \(P(x)=0\) are \(x=4\), \(x=12.8443\) and \(x=0.1557\), to 4 d.p. \(P(x)=0\) har altså tre løsninger: \(x=4\), \(x=12,8443\) og \(x=0,1557\).

name.text: 3.3.8.1 Solving polynomial equations graphically

questiontext.text:
Solving polynomial equations graphically Løse polynomligninger grafisk

Polynomial equations, particularly of high degree, are difficult to solve unless they take a particularly simple form. A useful guide to the approximate values of the solutions can be obtained by sketching the polynomial, and discovering where the curve crosses the \(x\)-axis. The real roots of the polynomial equation \(P(x)=0\) are given by the values of the intercepts of the function \(y=P(x)\) with the \(x\)-axis because on the \(x\)-axis \(y=P(x)\) is zero. Computer software packages and graphics alculators exist which can be used for plotting graphs and hence for solving polynomial equations approximately. Suppose the graph of \(y=P(x)\) is plotted and takes a form similar to that shown below. Polynomligninger, spesielt av høy grad, er vanskelige å løse med mindre de har en spesielt enkel form. En nyttig veiledning til de omtrentlige verdiene til løsningene kan fås ved å skissere polynomet, og finne ut hvor kurven krysser \(x\)-aksen. De reelle røttene til polynomligningen \(P(x)=0\) er gitt av verdiene til kjæringspunktet til funksjonen \(y=P(x)\) med \(x\)-aksen fordi på \(x\)-aksen er \(y=P(x)\) null. Dataprogramvarepakker og grafikkalkulatorer finnes som kan brukes til å plotte grafer og dermed til å løse polynomlikninger omtrentlig. Anta at grafen til \(y=P(x)\) er plottet og har en form som ligner på den som vises nedenfor.

The graph intersects the \(x\)-axis at \(x=x_1\), \(x=x_2\), and \(x=x_3\) and so the equation \(P(x)=0\) has three roots \(x_1\), \(x_2\), and \(x_3\), because \(P(x_1)=0\), \(P(x_2)=0\), and \(P(x_3)=0\). Grafen skjærer \(x\)-aksen ved \(x=x_1\), \(x=x_2\), og \(x=x_3\) som betyr at ligningen \(P(x)=0\) har tre røtter \(x_1\), \(x_2\) og \(x_3\), fordi \(P(x_1)=0\), \(P(x_2)=0\), og \(P( x_3)=0\).

Example Eksempel

Plot a graph of the function \(y=4x^4-15x^2+5x+6\) and hence approximately solve the equation \(4x^4-15x^2+5x+6 = 0\). Plot en graf av funksjonen \(y=4x^4-15x^2+5x+6\) og løs omtrentlig ligningen \(4x^4-15x^2+5x+6 = 0\).

Solution Løsning

The graph has been plotted here with the aid of a computer graph plotting package and is shown in the figure below. By hand, a less accurate result would be produced, of course. Grafen er plottet her ved hjelp av en datagrafplottingpakke og er vist i figuren nedenfor. For hånd vil selvfølgelig et mindre nøyaktig resultat bli produsert.

The solutions of the equation are found by looking for where the graph crosses the horizontal axis. Careful examination shows the solutions are at or close to \(x=1\), \(x=1.5\), \(x=-0.5\), \(x=-2\). Løsningene til ligningen finner du ved å finne hvor grafen krysser den horisontale aksen. Nøye undersøkelser viser at løsningene er ved eller nær \(x=1\), \(x=1,5\), \(x=-0,5\), \(x=-2\).

An important feature of the graph of a polynomial is that it is continuous. There are never any gaps or jumps in the curve. Polynomial curves never turn back on themselves in the horizontal direction, (unlike a circle). By studying the first graph in this section you will see that if we choose any two values of \(x\), say \(a\) and \(b\), such that \(y(a)\) and \(y(b)\) have opposite signs, then at least one root lies between \(x=a\) and \(x=b\). Et viktig trekk for grafen til et polynom er at den er kontinuerlig. Det er aldri noen hull eller hopp i kurven. Polynomkurver vender aldri tilbake på seg selv i horisontal retning (i motsetning til en sirkel). Ved å studere den første grafen i denne delen vil du se at hvis vi velger to verdier av \(x\), si \(a\) og \(b\), slik at \(y(a)\) og \(y(b)\) har motsatte fortegn, ligger minst en rot mellom \(x=a\) og \(x=b\).

Try for yourself: Consider the polynomial \(P(x)=5x^3-47x^2+84x\). By evaluating \(P(2)\) and \(P(3)\) show that at least one root of \(P(x)=0\) lies between \(x=2\) and \(x=3\). Prøv selv: Vurder polynomet \(P(x)=5x^3-47x^2+84x\). Ved å evaluere \(P(2)\) og \(P(3)\) ser vi at minst én rot av \(P(x)=0\) ligger mellom \(x=2\) og \(x= 3\).

Try for yourself: Without solving the equation or using a graphical calculator, show that \(x^4+4x-1=0\) has a root between \(x=0\) and \(x=1\). Prøv selv: Uten å løse ligningen eller bruke en grafisk kalkulator, vis at \(x^4+4x-1=0\) har en rot mellom \(x=0\) og \( x=1\).

name.text: 3.3.9.7 Show a root lies between two points I *****

questiontext.text:
Exercise

Consider the polynomial \(P(x)=5x^3-47x^2+84x\). By evaluating \(P(2)\) and \(P(3)\) show that at least one root of \(P(x)=0\) lies between \(x=2\) and \(x=3\).

name.text: 3.3.9.8 Show a root lies between two points II *****

questiontext.text:
Exercise

Without solving the equation or using a graphical calculator, show that \(x^4+4x-1=0\) has a root between \(x=0\) and \(x=1\).

name.text: 3.3.5.1 Verifying points

questiontext.text:
Exercise

Verify that the given values are solutions of the given equations.

  1. \(x^2-5x+6=0, \qquad x=3, x=2 \qquad \qquad \)

    [[1]]

  2. \(2t^3+t^2-t=0, \qquad t=0, t=-1, t=\dfrac{1}{2} \qquad\)

    [[1]]

partiallycorrectfeedback.text: Your answer is partially correct. That's a shame, as this was an incredibly easy mark.

incorrectfeedback.text: Your answer is incorrect. That's a shame, as these were incredibly easy marks.

selectoption.text: I have verified the given values
I have not verified the given values

name.text: 3.3.6.2A Factor determination from root

questiontext.text:
Exercise Øving

If \(a\) is root of polynomial \(p(x)\), which of the following is a factor of \(p(x)\) Hvis \(a\) er roten av polynomet \(p(x)\), hva er da en faktor av \(p(x)\)

generalfeedback.text: If \(x=a\) satisfies \(p(x)\) then \(x-a\) is a factor of \(p(x)\). Hvis \(x=a\) tilfredsstiller \(p(x)\) så er \(x-a\) en faktor i \(p(x)\).

correctfeedback.text: Your answer is correct. Svaret ditt er riktig.

partiallycorrectfeedback.text: Your answer is partially correct. Svaret ditt er delvis riktig.

incorrectfeedback.text: Your answer is incorrect. Svaret ditt er feil.

name.text: 3.3.1.2 Task: Degree of quadratic [NOT IN QUIZ]

questiontext.text:
Exercise

If \[{@pol@} = (x - {@aa@}) \times \hbox{ (a polynomial)},\] the degree of the undefined polynomial is [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]. [[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text: The previous key point tells us that a cubic is the product of a linear factor and a quadratic polynomial.

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

falsefeedback.text: The previous key point will offer you a great assistance in answer this question. Please, have a look.

name.text: 3.3.1.3 Task: Degree of coefficient of linear

questiontext.text:
Exercise Øving

  1. If \[{@aa@} x^2 + {@d1@} x + {@d2@} = (x + {@dd@}) \times p(x),\] the degree of the polynomial \(p(x)\) is [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]. Hvis \[{@aa@} x^2 + {@d1@} x + {@d2@} = (x + {@dd@}) \times p(x),\] er graden til polynomet \(p(x)\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]].
  2. What is the coefficient of \(x\) in the polynomial \(p(x)\)? Hva er koeffisienten til \(x\) i polynomet \(p(x)\)? [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]] [[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
1. A quadratic is the product of two linear polynomials. En andregradspolynom er produktet av to lineære polynomer.
  2. The coefficient must be \({@aa@}\) in order to generate the term \({@aa@}x^2\) when the linear factors are multiplied together. Koeffisienten må være \({@aa@}\) for å generere leddet \({@aa@}x^2\) når de lineære faktorene multipliseres sammen.

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

name.text: 3.3.1.4 Task: Coefficient of linear [NOT IN QUIZ]

questiontext.text:
Exercise

If \({@aa@} x^2 + {@d1@} x + {@d2@} = (x + {@dd@}) \times \hbox{ (a polynomial)}\), what must be the coefficient of \(x\) in this unknown polynomial? [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
We are given \({@aa@} x^2 + {@d1@} x + {@d2@} = (x + {@dd@}) \times \hbox{ (a polynomial)}\). We know that the polynomial multiplied by a linear function, \(x + {@dd@}\), must give a quadratic. Therefore the polynomial must also be a linear function, i.e. the polynomial is of the form \(ax + b\). Therefore

\[(x + {@dd@})(ax + b) = ax^2 + (a\cdot{@dd@} + b)x + b \cdot {@dd@}\].

Comparing coefficients of the \(x^2\) terms we see that \(a={@aa@}\).

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

truefeedback.text: Correct - the coefficient must be \({@aa@}\) in order to generate the term \({@aa@}x^2\) when the brackets are removed.

falsefeedback.text: The coefficient must be \({@aa@}\) in order to generate the term \({@aa@}x^2\) when the brackets are removed.

name.text: 3.3.1.5 Task: Degree of product of quadratics

questiontext.text:
Exercise Øving

Two quadratic polynomials are multiplied together. What is the degree of the resulting polynomial? To andregradspolynomer multipliseres sammen. Hva er graden av det resulterende polynomet? [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text: The degree of the product of two polynomials is the sum of the degrees of these polynomials. A quadratic has degree \(2\) so the product of two quadratics is \(4.\) Graden til produktet av to polynomer er summen av gradene til polynomene som multipliseres. Et andregradspolynom har grad \(2\), så produktet av to andregradspolynomer er \(4.\)

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

name.text: 3.3.3.1 Factorise cubic I

questiontext.text:
Exercise Øving

Factorise {@eqn@} into a linear and quadratic product given that {@factor@} is a factor: Faktoriser {@eqn@} til et produkt mellom en lineær og kvadratisk uttrykk, gitt at {@factor@} er en faktor:

\( {@eqn@} = ( {@factor@}) ( \) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] \( x^2 + \) [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]] \( x + \) [[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]] \( ) \) [[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
We can write \( {@eqn@} = ( {@factor@}) (ax^2 + bx + c) \). Vi kan skrive \( {@eqn@} = ( {@factor@}) (ax^2 + bx + c) \).

Try expanding the right hand side and equating the coefficients to find \(a\), \(b\), and \(c\). Be careful not to make a slip in your algebra! Prøv å åpne høyre side og likestill koeffisientene for å finne \(a\), \(b\) og \(c\). Vær forsiktig så du ikke glipper i algebraen din!

We obtain \( {@eqn@} = ( {@factor@}) ( x^2 + ({@bb@}) x + {@cc@} ) \) Tilslutt får vi \( {@eqn@} = ( {@factor@}) ( x^2 + ({@bb@}) x + {@cc@} ) \)

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

Et tall \(a\) er en rot av {@eqn@} hvis {@eqn=0@} når \(x=a\). Sett dermed inn hver verdi av \(x\) i {@eqn@} for å verifisere om verdien er en rot eller ikke.

name.text: 3.3.6.2a Task: Solve cubic given a root

questiontext.text:
Solve the equation \(x^3+8x^2+16x+3=0\) given that \(x=-3\) is a root.


Consider the equation \(x^3+8x^2+16x+3=0\). Given that \(x=-3\) is a root, state a linear factor of the cubic:  [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

name.text: 3.3.6.2B Solve cubic given a root

questiontext.text:
Exercise Øving

In this exercise we will solve the cubic {@eqn=0@} given that \(x={@root@}\) is a root. I denne oppgaven skal vi løse det kubiske uttrykket {@eqn=0@} gitt at \(x={@root@}\) er en rot.

The cubic can therefore be expressed as Polynomet kan derfor uttrykkes som

\( \qquad {@eqn = (x - root)*(a*x^2 + b*x + c)@} \)

where \(a\), \(b\), and \(c\) are constants. These can be found by expanding the right-hand side. hvor \(a\), \(b\) og \(c\) er konstanter. Disse finner du ved å utvide høyre side.

Expand the right-hand side: Utvid høyre side:

\( \qquad {@eqn@} = (\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] \() x^3 + (\) [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]] \()x^2 + (\) [[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]] \()x + \) [[input:ans4]] [[validation:ans4]]. [[feedback:prt1]]

We identify the unknown coefficients by focusing on the greatest and least powers first. Vi identifiserer de ukjente koeffisientene ved å fokusere på de største og minste potensene først.

Equate coefficients of \(x^3\) to find \(a\): Likestill koeffisientene til \(x^3\) for å finne \(a\): [[input:ans5]] [[validation:ans5]].

Equate constant terms to find \(c\): Likestill konstante ledd for å finne \(c\): [[input:ans6]] [[validation:ans6]].

With this we can now solve for \(b\). Med dette kan vi nå løse for \(b\).

Equate coefficients of \(x^2\) to find \(b\): Likestill koeffisientene til \(x^2\) for å finne \(b\): [[input:ans7]] [[validation:ans7]].

This enables us to write the equation as \({@(x-root)*quad=0@}\) so \({@x-root=0@}\) or \({@quad@}=0\). Dette gjør oss i stand til å skrive ligningen som \({@(x-root)*quad=0@}\) så \({@x-root=0@}\) eller \({@quad@}=0\).

Now solve the quadratic and state all three roots: Løs nå andregradsuttrykket og oppgi alle tre røtter: [[input:ans8]] [[validation:ans8]] 

Give your answer as a set of precise expressions. Gi svaret ditt som et set av presise uttrykk.

generalfeedback.text:
We are given the cubic \[{@eqn@} = {@(x - root)*(a*x^2 + b*x + c)@}.\] If we expand the RHS we obtain \[{@eqn@} = {@expand((x - root)*(a*x^2 + b*x + c))@}.\] Collecting like-terms we get Vi har fått det kubiske uttrykket \[{@eqn@} = {@(x - root)*(a*x^2 + b*x + c)@}.\] Hvis vi utvider høyre side får vi \[{@ eqn@} = {@expand((x - root)*(a*x^2 + b*x + c))@}.\] Ved å samle like-termer får vi\[{@eqn@} = {@ta1*x^3 + ta2*x^2 + ta3*x + ta4@}.\]

If we equate the coefficients of the LHS and RHS of the above equation, we obtain \(a = 1\), \(b = {@-2*aa@}\) and \(c={@aa^2-bb@}\). Hvis vi setter likhetstegn mellom koeffisientene på høyre og venstre side i ligningen ovenfor, får vi \(a = 1\), \(b = {@-2*aa@}\) og \(c={@aa^2- bb@}\).

This enables us to write the equation as \({@(x-root)*quad=0@}\) so \({@x-root=0@}\) or \({@quad@}=0\). Dette gjør oss i stand til å skrive ligningen som \({@(x-root)*quad=0@}\) så \({@x-root=0@}\) eller \({@quad@}=0\).

The quadratic equation can be solved using the quadratic formula to obtain \(x={@x2@}\) and \(x={@x3@}\). Andregradsuttrykket kan løses ved å bruke abc-formelen og få \(x={@x2@}\) og \(x={@x3@}\).

Thus the three roots of \({@eqn=0@}\) are \(x={@x1@}\), \(x={@x2@}\), and \(x={@x3@}.\) Dermed er de tre røttene til \({@eqn=0@}\): \(x={@x1@}\), \(x={@x2@}\), og \(x={@x3@}.\)

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

name.text: 3.3.6.2b Task: Solve cubic given a root

\( \qquad x^3+8x^2+16x+3= (x+3)(a x^2 + b x + c) \)

where \(a\), \(b\), and \(c\) are constants. These can be found by expanding the right-hand side.

Expand the right-hand side:

\( \qquad x^3+8x^2+16x+3= (\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] \() x^3 + (\) [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]] \()x^2 + (\) [[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]] \()x + \) [[input:ans4]] [[validation:ans4]].

name.text: 3.3.7.1 Solve cubic given a root I

questiontext.text:
Exercise Øving

Verify that the given value \(x={@x1@}\) is a solution of the equation \({@eqn@} = 0\) and hence find all solutions: Bekreft at den gitte verdien \(x={@x1@}\) er en løsning av ligningen \({@eqn@} = 0\) og finn videre alle løsninger:

\( x = \) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]  [[feedback:prt1]]

Give your answer as a set of precise numbers. Gi svaret ditt som et sett av presise tall.

generalfeedback.text: Try taking the factor of \( ({@x-x1@}) \) out of \({@eqn@} = 0\) in order to be left with a quadratic function \( {@ratsimp((x-x2)*(x-x3))@} = 0 \) which you can solve using the quadratic formula to obtain all solutions {@ta@}. Prøv å ta faktoren \( ({@x-x1@}) \) ut av \({@eqn@} = 0\) for å sitte igjen med en kvadratisk funksjon \( {@ratsimp((x-x2)*(x-x3))@} = 0 \) som du kan løse ved å bruke abc-formelen og få alle løsningene {@ta@}.

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

Verify that the given value \(x={@x1@}\) is a solution of the equation {@eqn@} and hence find all solutions:

generalfeedback.text: Try taking the factor of \( ({@x-x1@}) \) out of {@eqn@} in order to be left with a quadratic function \( {@2*x^2+bb*x+cc@} \) which you can solve using the quadratic formula to obtain all solutions {@ta@}.

questiontext.text:
Exercise

Verify that the given values \(x={@x1@}\) and \(x={@x4@}\) are solutions of the equation {@eqn@} and hence find all solutions:

\( x = \) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] 

Give your answer as a set of precise numbers.

[[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text: Try taking the factors of \( ({@x-x1@}) \) and \( ({@x-x4@}) \) out of {@eqn@} in order to be left with a quadratic function \( {@x^2+2*bb*x+bb^2-cc@} \) which you can solve using the quadratic formula to obtain all solutions {@ta@}.

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

name.text: 3.3.9.1 Factorise cubic given factor I [NOT IN QUIZ]

questiontext.text:
Exercise

Factorise {@eqn@} given that {@factor@} is a factor:

\( {@eqn@} = ( x + \) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] \() ( x + \) [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]] \() ( x + \) [[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]] \( ) \). [[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
We are given the expression \({@eqn@}\) for which we know \({@factor@}\) is a factor. Then we have \({@eqn@} = ({@factor@})(ax^2 + bx + c)\).

Expanding the brackets we obtain \[\begin{aligned} {@eqn@} &= ax^3 + bx^2 + cx + {@aa@}ax^2 + {@aa@}bx + {@aa@}c, \\ &= ax^3 + (b + {@aa@}a )x^2 + (c + {@aa@}b )x + {@aa@}c. \end{aligned}\]

Comparing coefficients we obtain \(a = 1\), \(b = {@ bb + cc @}\), and \(c = {@ bb*cc@}\).

Therefore we have \({@eqn@} = ({@factor@})({@quad@})\). Factorising, we obtain \[{@eqn@} = {@%eqn@}.\]

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

name.text: 3.3.9.2 Factorise cubic given factor II [NOT IN QUIZ]

questiontext.text:
Exercise

Check for yourself that \(x={@aa@}\) is a root of {@eqn@} and locate the other roots algebraically. Hence record all solutions:

\( x = \) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] (give your answer as a set of numbers). [[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
We are given the expression \({@eqn@}\) for which we know \(x = {@aa@}\) is a root. Therefore \({@factor@}\) is a factor. Then we have \({@eqn@} = ({@factor@})(ax^2 + bx + c)\).

Expanding the brackets we obtain \[\begin{aligned} {@eqn@} &= {@a*x^3 + b*x^2 + c*x - aa*a*x^2 - aa*b*x - aa*c@}, \\ &= {@a*x^3 + (b - aa*a )*x^2 + (c - aa*b )*x - aa*c@}. \end{aligned}\]

Comparing coefficients we obtain \(a = 1\), \(b = {@- bb - cc @}\), and \(c = {@ bb*cc@}\).

Therefore we have \({@eqn@} = ({@factor@})({@quad@})\). Factorising, we obtain \[{@eqn@} = {@%eqn@}.\]

Therefore the solutions are \(x - \{ {@aa@}, {@bb@}, {@cc@} \} \).

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

falsefeedback.text: Try taking the factor of \( ({@factor@}) \) out of {@eqn@} in order to be left with a quadratic function which you can factorise yourself or solve using the quadratic formula.

name.text: 3.3.9.3 Factorise cubic given factor with repeated root

questiontext.text:
Exercise Øving

Given that \(x={@aa@}\) is a root of \({@eqn@} = 0,\) determine the other roots. Hence record all roots. Gitt at \(x={@aa@}\) er en rot av \({@eqn@} = 0,\) bestem røttene.

 [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] 

Give your answer as a set of precise numbers. Gi svaret ditt som et set av presise tall.

[[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
By expanding \({@eqn@}=({@factor@})({x^2+bx+c})\) and equating coefficients we find \({@eqn@}=({@factor@})({@ratsimp(eqn/factor)@})\). Ved å utvide \({@eqn@}=({@factor@})({x^2+bx+c})\) og likestille koeffisientene finner vi \({@eqn@}=({@factor@} )({@ratsimp(eqn/factor)@})\).

From here we can solve the quadratic and find that the roots of the cubic are {@ta@}. Herfra kan vi bruke abc-formelen og finne at røttene til andregradsuttrykket er {@ta@}.

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

falsefeedback.text: Try taking the factor of \( (x - {@aa@}) \) out of {@eqn@} in order to be left with a quadratic function which you can factorise yourself or solve using the quadratic formula. Prøv å ta faktoren til \( (x - {@aa@}) \) ut av {@eqn@} for å sitte igjen med en kvadratisk funksjon som du kan faktorisere selv eller løse ved hjelp av abc-formelen.

name.text: 3.3.9.4 Factorise quartic with repeated roots x=+-a

questiontext.text:
Exercise Øving

Solve the equation {@eqn@}: Løs likningen {@eqn@}:

\( x = \) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]

Give your answer as a set of precise numbers. Only provide the distinct solutions. Gi svaret ditt som et sett av presise tall. Gi bare de distinkte løsningene.

[[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Try viewing this as a quadratic function of \(x^2.\) We solve for \(x^2\), from which we can obtain \(x\). Prøv å se dette som en kvadratisk funksjon av \(x^2.\) Vi løser for \(x^2\), hvorfra vi kan få \(x\).

We are given the equation {@eqn@}. Let \(y = x^2\). Then the equation becomes \[y^2 - {@2*aa^2*y@} + {@aa^4@} = 0.\] Recognise that this is equivalent to \((y - {@aa^2@})^2 = 0.\) Vi får ligningen {@eqn@}. La \(y = x^2\). Deretter blir ligningen \[y^2 - {@2*aa^2*y@} + {@aa^4@} = 0.\] Gjenkjenne at dette tilsvarer \((y - {@aa^2@})^2 = 0.\)

Therefore \(y = {@aa^2@}\) which implies \(x = \pm{@aa@}.\) Derfor er \(y = {@aa^2@}\) som innebærer at \(x = \pm{@aa@}.\)

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

falsefeedback.text: A useful property to notice is that this quadratic can be viewed as a quadratic polynomial in \(x^2\), so we can solve {@eqn@} for \(x^2\) (by factorising or using the quadratic formula) which will give us two expressions for \(x^2\), and this expression gives us the values of \(x\) as desired. En nyttig egenskap å legge merke til er at denne andregradslikningen kan sees på som et kvadratisk polynom i \(x^2\), så vi kan løse {@eqn@} for \(x^2\) (ved å faktorisere eller bruke den kvadratiske formelen ) som vil gi oss to uttrykk for \(x^2\), og dette uttrykket gir oss verdiene til \(x\) som ønsket.

name.text: 3.3.9.5 Factorise quartic given factor with repeating root

questiontext.text:
Exercise Øving

Factorise {@eqn@} given that {@factor@} is a factor: Faktoriser {@eqn@} gitt at {@factor@} er en faktor:

\( {@eqn@} = ( x + \) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] \() ( x + \) [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]] \() ( x + \) [[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]] \( ) ( x + \) [[input:ans4]] [[validation:ans4]] \( ) \). [[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text: We are given the expression {@eqn@} and are told that \({@factor@}\) is a factor of the expression. Then \[{@eqn@} = ({@factor@})(ax^3 + bx^2 + cx + d).\] Expand the RHS of the above equation and equate the coefficients to find \[ ax^3 + bx^2 + cx + d = {@expand((x + cc)*(x + bb)*(x + aa))@}.\] From here, try substituting in values of \(x\) to find another root. We could, for example, notice that \({@factor@}\) is actually a factor of this cubic, i.e. it is a factor of multiplicity \(2\) of the original quartic. Then \[{@eqn@} = ({@factor@})^2(ax^2 + bx + c).\] Expand the RHS of the above equation and equate the coefficients to find \[ax^2 + bx + c = {@expand((x + bb)*(x + aa))@}.\] We can then factorise this quadratic as \({@(x + bb)*(x + aa)@}\). Therefore the original quartic can be expressed as \({@%eqn@}\). Vi får uttrykket {@eqn@} og blir fortalt at \({@factor@}\) er en faktor i uttrykket. Da er \[{@eqn@} = ({@factor@})(ax^3 + bx^2 + cx + d).\] Utvid høyre side og likestill koeffisientene for å få \[ ax^3 + bx^2 + cx + d = {@expand((x + cc)*(x + bb)*(x + aa))@}.\] Herfra kan du prøve å sette inn ulike verdier av \(x\) til finne en annen rot. Vi kan for eksempel legge merke til at \({@factor@}\) faktisk er en faktor av denne kubiske likningen, dvs. den har er en multiplisitetsfaktor på \(2\) i den opprinnelige fjerdegradspolynomet. Da har vi \[{@eqn@} = ({@factor@})^2(ax^2 + bx + c).\] Utvid høyre side for ligningen ovenfor og likestill koeffisientene for å få \[ax^2 + bx + c = {@expand((x + bb)*(x + aa))@}.\] Vi kan så faktorisere dette kvadratet som \({@(x + bb)*(x + aa)@}\) . Derfor kan det opprinnelige fjerdegradspolynomet uttrykkes som \({@%eqn@}\).

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

name.text: 3.3.9.6 Factorise quartic given two factors same modulus (NOT IN QUIZ)

questiontext.text:
Exercise

Given that two of the roots of {@eqn@} have the same modulus but different sign, solve the equation:

\( {@eqn@} = ( x + \) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] \() ( x + \) [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]] \() ( x + \) [[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]] \( ) ( x + \) [[input:ans4]] [[validation:ans4]] \( ) \).

List the factors in non-decreasing order in terms of the constant term in the linear factor, repeating roots if appropriate.

Hint: let two of the roots be \(\alpha\) and \(-\alpha\) and use the technique of equating coefficients.

[[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
We know that both \(a\) and \(-a\) are roots, and that the leading coefficient is \(1\) so we can write the polynomial as \( (x - a) (x + a) (x^2 + bx + c)\). 

Expanding this gives 

\[ {@eqn@}= {@ratsimp((x - a) *(x + a) *(x^2 + b*x + c))@} .\]

By equating coefficients we find from the cubic term \(b={@aa + bb + cc + dd@}\) and then this information and the linear term gives \(a^2={@(aa)^2@}\). We can then use the constant (or quadratic) term to find \(c\). From here we solve the quadratic  \(x^2+bx+c=0\) to determine the unknown roots. In total we have 

\[{@eqn@}={@eqn1@}.\]

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.
